content.description: Sit down start at the black streak on the north face.
content.location: After ascending the chains, it is to the left of the russet boulder on the "Rotten Potato" Boulder. It is to the left of "Eye Gouger"

content.description: Start on sloper to the left of face, climb up into pinch and exit left
content.location: behind bigtime, separate boulder

content.description: Start on left sloper climb right into crack feature
content.location: tucked away on a separate boulder next to rotten potato

content.description: Start on a good left hand pinch, good feet and a slimmer of a crimp for the right hand. move up through a good right hand side pull and hueco patina crimps.
content.protection: Pad, nice landing, try to avoid placing pads on the plant life.
content.location: Just to the right of the southWest arete of The Russet boulder. When traveling through the small potatoes pass through the slit right before Big Time boulder and it's immediately on your left.

content.description: A short but fun climb that features a powerful top out. Start on incut holds at shoulder height and go straight up.
content.protection: Crash pad, spotter to keep you off the rocks behind.
content.location: Directly to the left of the corridor that leads to the Big Time boulder (directly left of And The Bucket Of Parts).

content.description: Start on a hueco about 6 feet off the ground and 15 feet left of where the trail ducks between boulders
content.protection: crash pad and spotter for the rocks behind
content.location: left of Mrs. Potato Head

content.description: Climb the crack. Top out. Getting down might be harder than getting up.
content.location: The obvious right leaning crack.

content.description: Casual jugs by the crack splitting the northwest face.
content.location: After ascending the chains, it is to the left of the russet boulder on the "Rotten Potato" Boulder. To the right of "Eye Gouger"

content.description:
sit start with matched hands, long traverse up and left with plenty of options for both your hands and feet.   

  the crux is rounding the arete.
content.location: at the top of trail go left, it will be on your right after about 7 meters...it will be very obvious

content.description: Start inverted or not on hand jams or a butterfly stack low in the crack. Kick your legs up and past constrictions on hand stacks or face holds, then shuffle upward feet first until you can reach the lip and pull yourself upright to top out. An easy introduction to inversions and hand-stacks.The moves may only rate 2 points on the V-scale, but consensus was they would earn at least 5 on Insta for style.
content.protection: Two pads, or one and a spotter.
content.location: Right in front of you as you enter the Small Potatoes area from the chain trail. It is the obvious short, steep OW crack between the Baker and it's adjacent boulder. The problem is between Mrs. Potatohead & And the Bucket of Parts.Â

content.description: Start in the large round hueco and climb straight up to top out.
content.location: Follow the chain trail up from the east parking where the Small Potatoes are. This route will be on the boulder to your left.

content.description:
This climb is aptly named as climbing this is probably like wrestling a hog. 

  Sit start squeezing an arete and work your way up and right into some handjams.  Make a big move around the prow to obtain some good holds and work your feet out from underneath the boulder and up by your hands.  From here wrestle your way up to make a big move to good hueco's above. 

  It felt like the wall next to start is considered off for feet but ok to hand jam against and fingerlock against higher, not sure on this however.
content.location: In the A-Frame area, directly opposite the Baby Baker boulder.  Crawl through the entrance and "The Hog" will be on your left side after the corridor opens up.  Shares start with "The Hog Left".  "Cast Iron" is 10ft further down the corridor.

content.description: Start LOW on right hand rail and left hand gastone. Make thuggy moves up a sort-of arete feature, squeezing your way to a hard encounter to gain crimp edges on the face above. Drop off at large in-cut or climb right and top out slab.
content.location: Top of the chains. This climb is on The Hog boulder in the cave with the A-frame opening at the Small Potato area.

content.description: Stem up the dihedral. I haven't done this, but it looks like a lot of fun. If anyone has any insight, please feel free to add it! Otherwise, I'll add more detail once I do it!
content.location: To the right of Beefy Reef. Look for the tall corner. Just over a couple boulders as you're leaving the main Small Potatoes area, and before you get to Big Time.

content.description: Short climb on the right side of Baby Baker coming up from the chains.
content.location: Just to the right of Bassin'.

content.description: Start on jug under-cling and right hand divot on wall, up to jug rail, big ugly move to start of cast iron.
content.location: in the a frame top of the chains

content.description:
This line makes for a good warmup for your bouldering head.  It's different than most of Hueco as it's mainly footwork with very little in  the way of hands.  Feels quite a bit harder than most of the other classic V1's.  From the back of the A-frame climb up the smooth bullet face on your left.  As you get higher the angle lowers, but somehow it still feels like you're climbing. 

  To descend walk around to come down the standard Bawl and Chain descent.  Or continue over to the Gymnasium to continue on the highball warmup tour.
content.protection: A cool head, a pad and spotter can be used to protect the lower moves.  Up high it's best not to fall.
content.location: Once at the small potatoes area, crawl under the boulders to encounter the A-Frame area.  The entrance is about 10 feet left of the highball face of Bawl and Chain.

content.description:
Sit start on the right hand side, traverse left, then go up, mount the slab, and keep going. The last couple moves as you leave the huecos and get onto the slab is the crux, which is pretty safe, but there's no way down once you're on the slab. The slab is cake.

 Super fun!!!
content.location: Hop over the boulders in the SW corner of the main Small Potatoes area. Look for a line of huecos from chest to head height, to the left of a tall corner.

content.description:
Beautiful straight forward highball, great warm up for your mind and body.  Mostly your head. 

  It can get pretty windy at the top of these boulders. Walk off near In the Bucket of Parts.
content.location: main wall, just left of route in the picture for 'small potatoes' (both pictures share the same crack, the chalked up crack to my right is the same as the one to his left)

content.description: Start slightly above and to the far right of the route Honey Hole. As you reach the top there will be a nice hold to your left and a perfect rail to your right to top out.
content.location: Follow the chain trail up from the east parking where the Small Potatoes are. This route will be on the boulder to your left and to the right of the route Honey Hole.

content.description: Bad feet at the start and then up
content.location: On Baby Baker on the face around the corner from the face toward the chains trail.

content.description: The majority of the problems here are V0, and 9 have one or more stars (according to Sherman guide,) which makes it a great place to warm up.
